title: Why do I love creating music so much even though I am not very good at it? - Quora

response.answer_text: You’re always improving, and that’s satisfying. Maybe it’s not good overall, but hearing that improvement, and hearing yourself create something that… kinda sounded a little bit decent… Is compelling. So you keep doing it, and keep improving, and keep fuelling the passion, and then eventually you will love it AND be happy with what you create. Seriously keep at it. It’s a great passion to have. Now at 31 I really feel like I’m starting to zero in on some really great writing. It’s a satisfying, though often tedious and frustrating hobby… But so damn satisfying…  Here’s a song I wrote a few years back that I was always very happy with

Creating music can be very theraputic and there’s the satisfaction of producing something. As for not being very good at it, the more time you spend creating music, the more your skills will develop. Also, what is “good” is partly subjective and it’s easy to be overly criticial of our own work (I listen back to stuff I recorded years ago and cringe at some of it!) and also compare ourselves to others. If you enjoy creating music and others enjoy listening to your efforts, then that is good! :)
